title: Page 44: SEC Chairman Arthur Levitt warned of coming accounting disaster. See, for example, “SEC Chairman Arthur Levitt, Concerned that the Quality of Corporate Financial Reporting Is Eroding, Announces Action Plan to Remedy Problem

Page 44: Public Company Accounting Reform and Investor Protection Act. In 2002, Congress passed this new law, making it more difficult for companies to cook their books. However, three months later, the Bush administration threatened to undermine the legislation in two ways: first, by slashing the funding needed to implement the law, and, second, by appointing an industry-friendly official to head the public company accounting board that would oversee the industry
